thread.title: BREAKING: '7 dead' as bomb blast hits busy shopping street
thread.title_full: BREAKING: '7 dead' as bomb blast hits busy shopping street

title: BREAKING: '7 dead' as bomb blast hits busy shopping street
text:
The powerful blast left devastation across the shopping street in Lahore, Pakistan. 
At least 7 people have been reported dead and 15 injured in the attack. 
TWITTER LAHORE: The bomb blast rocked the shopping street in Pakistan Terror attack at Bacha Khan University Thursday, 21st January 2016 Gunmen opened fire at Bacha Khan University in Charsadda, Pakistan killing at least 19 people. 1 / 14 EPA Pakistani security official inspect the premises of Bacha Khan University after a gunfight between security forces and gunmen, in Charsadda, Pakistan 
TWITTER PAKISTAN: At least 7 are dead in Lahore “We cannot confirm figures as the rescue operation is under way” Police 
Armed police are on the scene following the explosion which destroyed cars and shattered windows of shops. 
Pakistani officials have confirmed it was a bomb attack and there are reports it was a device strapped to a motorcycle. 
Security forces, suspecting the bomber was still alive, cordoned off the market in a residential neighbourhood, home to banks and coffee shops, and people were not being allowed to leave or enter. 
Last year, ISIS launched a terror attack in Quetta, Pakistan , when gunmen in suicide vests stormed a police HQ killing at least 59 and wounding 117. 
TWITTER BOMB: Lahore police confirmed the blast was an explosive device 
A witness who works at a bank in the market said that his workplace was shaken by a “frightening” explosion. 
“We left the building and saw that the motor-bikes parked outside were on fire and all the windows in the surrounding buildings were shattered,” the witness, Mohammad Khurram, said. 
“There are casualties and injuries but we cannot confirm figures as the rescue operation is under way,” Punjab police spokesman Nayab Haider said. 
TWITTER EXPLOSION: Lahore was hit in the latest attack to hit Pakistan Terror attacks 2016 We take a look at the terrorist attacks of 2016. 1 / 37 REUTERS A truck crashed into a Christmas market in Berlin killing at least 12 and injuring 48 
Intials reports suggested a generator had exploded but sources in the Punjab police and provincial government confirmed it was a bomb. 
Pakistan has been struck by a wave of terrorist attacks in recent weeks, killing at least 130 people across the country and leaving hundreds wounded. 
Anti-terror cops in Pakistan killed 130 suspected terrorists have been killed and arrested over 350 people as they attempt to crackdown on terrorism. 
MORE TO FOLLOW
